comment.text: Tetrapolymerization of the monopyrrole PBG into the hydroxymethylbilane pre-uroporphyrinogen in several discrete steps.

temperatureDependence.text: Displays high thermal stability. The half-denaturation temperature (Tm) is about 74 degrees Celsius.

comment.text: Porphyrin-containing compound metabolism; protoporphyrin-IX biosynthesis; coproporphyrinogen-III from 5-aminolevulinate: step 2/4.
Isoform 1 is ubiquitously expressed. Isoform 2 is found only in erythroid cells.

disease.name: Acute intermittent porphyria
disease.description: A form of porphyria. Porphyrias are inherited defects in the biosynthesis of heme, resulting in the accumulation and increased excretion of porphyrins or porphyrin precursors. They are classified as erythropoietic or hepatic, depending on whether the enzyme deficiency occurs in red blood cells or in the liver. AIP is an autosomal dominant form of hepatic porphyria characterized by attacks of gastrointestinal disturbances, abdominal colic, with neurological dysfunctions, hypertension, tachycardia and peripheral neuropathy. Most attacks are precipitated by drugs, alcohol, caloric deprivation, infections, or endocrine factors.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
The porphobilinogen subunits are added to the dipyrromethane group.

feature.description: In AIP; less than 1% of wild-type deaminase activity; dbSNP:rs998842815.
In AIP; severe decrease in deaminase activity; dbSNP:rs118204103.
In AIP; results in less than 1% of wild-type deaminase activity.
In AIP; less than 3% of activity.
In AIP; unknown pathological significance; has 80% of wild-type deaminase activity; dbSNP:rs761004837.
In AIP; complete loss of deaminase activity.
In AIP; loss of activity; affects protein conformation; lower thermal stability than wild-type enzyme; dbSNP:rs118204094.

Found in a patient with unclear porphyria-related biochemical findings and abdominal pain; unknown pathological significance; does not affect activity; does not affect Vmax; does not affect KM; does not affect thermal stability; dbSNP:rs551209435.
In AIP; loss of deaminase activity; dbSNP:rs118204098.
In AIP; decreased deaminase activity due to defective enzyme-intermediate complexes turnover and regeneration of free enzyme molecules; dbSNP:rs118204095.
In AIP; results in less than 5% of wild-type activity; 2-fold decrease of Vmax; 33-fold increase of KM; dbSNP:rs118204101.
In AIP; less than 1% of wild-type activity; dbSNP:rs118204096.
In AIP; 1% of wild-type activity; lower thermal stability than wild-type enzyme; dbSNP:rs575222284.
In AIP; unknown pathological significance; has 80% of wild-type deaminase activity; dbSNP:rs536814318.
In AIP; severe decrease of deaminase activity; dbSNP:rs34413634.
In AIP; 46% wild-type deaminase activity; decreased enzyme stability.
In AIP; unknown pathological significance; results in 30% of wild-type activity; 3-fold decrease of Vmax; normal KM; affects protein conformation.
In AIP; 19% of wild-type deaminase activity.
In AIP; severe decrease of deaminase activity; dbSNP:rs118204111.
